summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, dated November 24, 2021. It announces the production of additional witness materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio materials for potential trial witnesses, and other materials for individuals not currently intended to be called. The letter emphasizes the materials are subject to a protective order.

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act, Giglio, and other witness-related materials to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Issuance of Protective Order
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the confidentiality of materials like those produced in this letter.

locations: 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl. New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government was producing Jencks Act and Giglio materials for witnesses it might call in Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The government was also producing materials related to individuals it did NOT currently intend to call as witnesses, containing certain witness statements.
All produced materials were governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and marked to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The government reserved the right to call individuals listed in the index for non-witnesses at a later date.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams, indicating high-level oversight of the case.
